entry.title: A Supreme Court Justice will shape civil liberties for...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

A Supreme Court Justice will shape civil liberties for generations. Rushing the nomination process threatens the legitimacy of the Court. Urge Senator Cory Gardner to delay the nomination until after the inauguration: https://bit.ly/3mebtL2

entry.title: Join us today at noon and learn how to mobilize around a clear...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us today at noon and learn how to mobilize around a clear vision of community safety by addressing solutions that move away from policing of our neighbors. https://go.peoplepower.org/event/action/22710…

entry.title: Locking up people experiencing poverty, mental illness or...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Locking up people experiencing poverty, mental illness or addiction benefits no one. COVID-19 has made it clear, Colorado can safely cut dangerous jail and prison populations, save taxpayer money and treat everyone equally. Community over cages.

For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.

sentinelcolorado.com

EDITORIAL: The region’s free, get-out-of-jail card — courtesy of the coronavirus - Sentinel Colorado

For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.For decades, Colorado has ruined lives and wasted billions of tax dollars by not modernizing incarceration guidelines for state jails and prisons. The pandemic has show we can make those changes now.

entry.title: Amendment 76 is an issue of voter suppression. It was brought to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 is an issue of voter suppression. It was brought to our ballot by a Florida-based organization intending to push their anti-immigrant agenda in Colorado while disenfranchising our newly empowered 17 year-olds.

If passed, it would take away the right for 17 year-olds to vote in primary elections — a law passed last year which gave voter access to nearly 24,000 17-year-old voters. Amendment 76 is intentionally deceptive and has no place in our state. Vote #NoOn76

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: Awarding our electoral college votes to the winner of the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Awarding our electoral college votes to the winner of the national popular vote in all 50 states will give us a direct voice over the selection of the U.S. President. Every vote will count equally, and the person with the most votes will win every time. Vote #YesOn113

entry.title: Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a newborn baby, or a seriously ill family member at some point, but 4 out of 5 Coloradans don’t have access to paid family and medical leave. Proposition 118 will allow Coloradans to put their families first without having to risk losing their job. Vote #YesOn118

entry.title: Black, Latinx and Indigenous communities continue to fight...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Black, Latinx and Indigenous communities continue to fight against the use of police violence against their loved ones. To truly feel safe, we must move beyond a system of policing and caging.

Join Campaign Coordinator Jen Samano and Field Organizer Julian Camera on October 22 for the final presentation in this webinar series to discuss how we can mobilize around a clear vision of community safety by addressing solutions that move away from policing of our neighbors. https://go.peoplepower.org/event/action/22710…

entry.title: Proposition 115 is an intentionally confusing ballot measure to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Proposition 115 is an intentionally confusing ballot measure to ban abortion later in pregnancy with no exceptions for health or individual circumstances. Proponents of this ballot measure have said outright they want to force a woman to carry a pregnancy to term — even in cases of rape, risks to the person's health, or a lethal fetal diagnosis.

This one-size-fits-all mandate is being pushed by many of the same politicians and groups who have tried to ban abortion in Colora...do every year for the last decade. It allows politics to dictate personal health decisions that should be made by a pregnant person and their family, in consultation with their doctors.

It does not take into account the unique circumstances each person may face throughout pregnancy. Health needs should drive important medical decisions — not politics.

Help protect Colorado’s access to abortion care and Vote #NoOn115.

See More

entry.title: The following people are eligible to register and vote in...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The following people are eligible to register and vote in Colorado:

✅People who have completed their criminal sentence
✅People currently in jail pretrial (pending the outcome of the criminal case)
✅People currently on probation for either a misdemeanor or a felony...
✅People currently in jail serving a misdemeanor sentence only

Individuals who are presently incarcerated for a felony are currently not eligible to vote. However, they will be eligible to vote after serving their sentence. If you were registered to vote prior to your incarceration for a felony conviction, your registration will have been canceled, and you must re-register to vote.

For more info on voting with a criminal record, provided by Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition, visit https://votingwithconviction.org/can-i-vote/

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by filling out your ballot at home and returning it to a drop box. Keep in-person polls open for those who really need it like first-time voters, voters who need assistance, and your neighbors who work multiple jobs.

Grab your blue or black ink pen, vote at home, sign the back and don't forget to grab your mask if your dropping off your ballot at a drive-through drop box.

Find your nearest drop box and drive-through* v...oting locations: https://www.sos.state.co.us/pubs/elections/VIP.html

*Not available in all counties.

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: Thank you, Representative Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez, HD4, for...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Thank you, Representative Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez, HD4, for continuing the fight for youth voter access and urging Coloradans to #VoteNoOn76.

entry.title: Reminder: You can always rely on the Secretary of State's...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Reminder: You can always rely on the Secretary of State's website for accurate info on voting, registering to vote, and election results. For more info visit www.GoVoteColorado.gov.

Colorado Secretary of State's Office

Secretary of State Jena Griswold: To combat foreign interference, we are launching a new initiative reminding Coloradans that “opinions are fun, but facts are b...etter.” When it comes to election information, visit www.GoVoteColorado.gov for reliable information on registering, voting safely, and election results. #TrustedInfo2020 #FactsareBetter https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/2020/PR20201020Misinformation…

entry.title: “Tens of thousands of newly eligible young voters eager to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

“Tens of thousands of newly eligible young voters eager to participate in our democracy would be disenfranchised each primary season by Amendment 76.”

When young people are engaged in our democracy we all win. Stop youth voter suppression. Vote NO on 76!

entry.title: You have a right to cast your ballot free from intimidation....
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

You have a right to cast your ballot free from intimidation. Know your rights and how to report violations:

Within 100 feet of a building in which a VSPC or ballot drop box is located, you have the right to vote or wait without anyone trying to influence your vote.

If you witness someone trying to influence votes within 100 feet of these locations, please call the toll free Election Protection hotline:

...

1 866 OUR VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or the Spanish language hotline 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682). Email us at: voting@aclu-co.org.

If you do not speak English, you have the right to receive assistance from someone who speaks your language and English.

For more info and guidance on voter intimidation and disinformation, visit https://justvotecolorado.org/index.php/faqs/

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: Want to vote in-person? Colorado Voter Service & Polling...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Want to vote in-person? Colorado Voter Service & Polling Centers (VSPC) have opened today, and will stay open until November 3rd at 7 p.m. All in-person VSPC locations will follow public health guidelines to ensure that you, the voters, will be safe while casting your ballot. If you're heading over to a VSPC to vote, don't forget to bring identification since it is required to vote in person.

To find a VSPC near you, go to: https://www.sos.state.co.us/pubs/elections/VIP.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: If you do not have a fixed permanent home, you are still...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If you do not have a fixed permanent home, you are still eligible to register to vote and cast a ballot. Voting in person is also an option for you if your mail in ballot is not accessible. For more info on voting without a permanent address, visit: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/F…/foreclosureHomelessFAQ.html

Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information
